alert.note: Alert for Canyonlands, Natural Bridges; La Sal and Abajo Mountains (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GrandJunction (Western Colorado and Eastern Utah)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 23 at 7:31PM MST by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...A SNOW SQUALL WILL AFFECT PARTS OF PARADOX VALLEY/LOWER DOLORES RIVER...LA SAL AND ABAJO MOUNTAINS...AND CANYONLANDS/NATURAL BRIDGES COUNTIES... HAZARDS...A snow squall which can rapidly reduce visibility to less than a quarter of a mile. LOCATION AND MOVEMENT...At 730 PM MST, a snow squall was along a line extending from 22 miles northwest of Monticello to 9 miles southwest of La Sal to 14 miles west of Slick Rock and moving northeast at 40 MPH. THIS SQUALL WILL BE NEAR... La Sal around 755 PM MST. Spanish Valley around 810 PM MST. This includes the following highways... U.S. Highway 191 in Utah between mile markers 91 and 117. Colorado 90 between mile markers 1 and 15. Colorado 141 between mile markers 81 and 91. SAFETY INFO... Use extra caution if you must travel into or through this squall. Rapid changes in visibility and potentially slick roads may lead to accidents. &&

area.areaDesc: Canyonlands, Natural Bridges; La Sal and Abajo Mountains
